entry.title: New release for Slink: v1.4.5
entry.content:
This patch reverts back to the root user by default but keeps the possibility to alter this behavior manually. See related issue #38.

The decision was made because I donâ€™t want to overcomplicate the deployment for new users, so non-root user becomes a feature rather than the default behavior.

Here is an example of a Docker Compose configuration for running as a non-root user: yaml services: slink: user: slink # Your other configurations

[!NOTE] By running as a non-root user, you will need to resolve permission issues for mounted volumes manually, as nothing can be done at the container level.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/andrii-kryvoviaz/slink/compare/v1.4.4...v1.4.5
